meanings.definition: A group of binary digits or bits operated on as a unit.
meanings.sent1: The computer processed the bytes quickly.
meanings.sent2: She saved the file, which contained several bytes of data.
meanings.sent3: The bytes in the system had a party and danced around the circuits.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a maze of interconnected bytes, each holding a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The bytes glowed brightly on the screen, revealing the hidden information.

meanings.definition: A unit of digital information equivalent to eight bits.
meanings.sent1: The image file was only a few kilobytes in size, just a few bytes.
meanings.sent2: The email attachment was too large, exceeding several megabytes of data, thousands of bytes.
meanings.sent3: The bytes in the computer were on strike, demanding better working conditions.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like bytes of wisdom, small but powerful in impact.
meanings.sent5: The bytes of music filled the room, creating a symphony of sound.
